name: appmixer.smartsheet.core.ListHomeContents
author: Appmixer <info@appmixer.com>
description: Gets a nested list of all Home objects, including dashboards, folders, reports, sheets, templates, and workspaces, as shown on the "Home" tab.

sheets.description: Array of Sheet objects (containing just the sheet Id) of any sheets that the requester has access to that make up the report.

fromId.description: The Id of the template from which to create the sheet. This attribute can be specified in a request, but is never present in a response.

ownerId.description: User Id of the sheet owner.

attachments.description:
Array of Attachment objects.
Only returned if the [include](../../tag/sheets#operation/getSheet) query string parameter contains **attachments**.

attachmentType.description: Attachment type. * types are not supported for Smartsheet.gov accounts.

attachmentSubType.description: Attachment sub type. * type is for EGNYTE values and the rest are GOOGLE_DRIVE values.

parentType.description: The type of object the attachment belongs to.

createdBy.description: `User` object containing `name` and `email` of the user who created this attachment.

sizeInKb.description: The size of the file, if the attachmentType is FILE.

urlExpiresInMillis.description: Attachment temporary URL time to live (files only).

autoNumberFormat.description: Object that describes how the the System Column type of "AUTO_NUMBER" is auto-generated.

fill.description: Indicates zero-padding. Must be between 0 and 10 "0" (zero) characters.

startingNumber.description: The starting number for the auto-id.

contactOptions.description: Array of ContactOption objects to specify a pre-defined list of values for the column. Column **type** must be **CONTACT_LIST**.

name.description: Can be a user's name, display name, or free text.

format.description: The format descriptor (see [Formatting](../../#section/API-Basics/Formatting)). Only returned if the **include** query string parameter contains **format** and this column has a non-default format applied to it.

formula.description: The formula for the column, if set.

hidden.description: Indicates whether the column is hidden.

index.description: Column index or position. This number is zero-based.

locked.description: Indicates whether the column is locked. In a response, a value of **true** indicates that the column has been locked by the sheet owner or the admin.

lockedForUser.description: Indicates whether the column is locked for the requesting user. This attribute may be present in a response, but cannot be specified in a request.

options.description: Array of the options available for the column.

primary.description: Returned only if the column is the Primary Column (value = **true**).

symbol.description: When applicable for **CHECKBOX** or **PICKLIST** column types. See [Symbol Columns](../../tag/columnsRelated#section/Column-Types/Symbol-Columns).

tags.description: Set of tags to indicate special columns. Each element in the array is set to one of the listed enum values.

title.description: Column title.

validation.description: Indicates whether validation has been enabled for the column (value = **true**).

version.description:
* `0`: CONTACT_LIST, PICKLIST, or TEXT_NUMBER.
* `1`: MULTI_CONTACT_LIST.
* `2`: MULTI_PICKLIST.

width.description: Display width of the column in pixels.

crossSheetReferences.description:
Array of CrossSheetReference objects.
Only returned if the [include](../../tag/sheets#operation/getSheet) query string parameter contains **crossSheetReferences**.

endColumnId.description: Defines ending edge of range when specifying one or more columns. To specify an entire column, omit the startRowId and endRowId parameters.

endRowId.description: Defines ending edge of range when specifying one or more rows. To specify an entire row, omit the startColumnId and endColumnId parameters.

id.description: Cross-sheet reference Id, guaranteed unique within referencing sheet.

name.description: Friendly name of reference. Auto-generated unless specified in Create Cross-sheet References.

startColumnId.description: Defines beginning edge of range when specifying one or more columns. To specify an entire column, omit the startRowId and endRowId parameters.

startRowId.description: Defines beginning edge of range when specifying one or more rows. To specify an entire row, omit the startColumnId and endColumnId parameters.

status.description:
Status of request:
 * 'BLOCKED' - A reference is downstream of a circular issue.
 * 'BROKEN' - The data source location (column, row or sheet) was
deleted.
 * 'CIRCULAR' - The formula reference is self referencing and cannot
be resolved.
 * 'DISABLED' - Updating the reference is temporarily disabled due
to maintenance.
 * 'INVALID/UNKNOWN' - The reference is new and had not been validated.
 * 'NOT_SHARED' - No common shared users.
 * 'OK' - The reference is in a good state.

effectiveAttachmentOptions.description: Array of enum strings (see [Attachment.attachmentType](../../tag/attachmentsDescription) indicating the allowable attachment options for the current user and sheet.

favorite.description: Returned only if the user has marked this sheet as a favorite in their Home tab (value = **true**).

hasSummaryFields.description: Indicates whether a sheet summary is present.

owner.description: Email address of the sheet owner.

permalink.description: URL that represents a direct link to the sheet in Smartsheet.

projectSettings.description: Represents the project settings dependencies for a specific sheet. Project settings may be updated on sheets that the user has editor access.

lengthOfDay.description: Length of a workday for a project sheet.

nonWorkingDays.description: Non-working days for a project sheet.

readOnly.description: Returned only if the sheet belongs to an expired trial (value = **true**).

resourceManagementEnabled.description: Indicates that resource management is enabled.

resourceManagementType.description: Resource Management type. Indicates the type of RM that is enabled.

sheetId.description: Parent sheet Id.

attachments.description: Attachments on row. Only returned if the include query string parameter contains attachments.

attachmentSubType.description: Attachment sub type. * type is for EGNYTE values and the rest are GOOGLE_DRIVE values.

columnId.description: The Id of the column that the cell is located in.

columnType.description: Only returned if the include query string parameter contains **columnType**.

conditionalFormat.description: The format descriptor describing this cell's conditional format. Only returned if the include query string parameter contains **format** and this cell has a conditional format applied.

displayValue.description: Visual representation of cell contents, as presented to the user in the UI.

format.description: The format descriptor. Only returned if the include query string parameter contains **format** and this cell has a non-default format applied.

formula.description: The formula for a cell, if set, for instance **=COUNTM([Assigned To]3)**. Note that calculation errors or problems with a formula do not cause the API call to return an error code. Instead, the response contains the same value as in the UI, such as **cell.value = "#CIRCULAR REFERENCE"**.

reportId.description: If non-null, this hyperlink is a link to the report with this Id.

sheetId.description: If non-null, this hyperlink is a link to the sheet with this Id.

sightId.description: If non-null, this hyperlink is a link to the dashboard with this Id.

url.description: When the hyperlink is a URL link, this property contains the URL value. When the hyperlink is a dashboard/report/sheet link (that is, dashboardId, reportId, or sheetId is non-null), this property contains the permalink to the dashboard, report, or sheet.

height.description: Original height (in pixels) of the uploaded image.

width.description: Original width (in pixels) of the uploaded image.

columnId.description: Column Id of the linked cell.

rowId.description: Row Id of the linked cell.

sheetId.description: Sheet Id of the sheet that the linked cell belongs to.

sheetName.description: Sheet name of the linked cell.

status.description:
* `BLOCKED` One of several other values indicating unusual error conditions.
* `BROKEN` The row or sheet linked to was deleted.
* `CIRCULAR` One of several other values indicating unusual error conditions.
* `DISABLED` One of several other values indicating unusual error conditions.
* `INACCESSIBLE` The sheet linked to cannot be viewed by this user.
* `INVALID` One of several other values indicating unusual error conditions.
* `NOT_SHARED` One of several other values indicating unusual error conditions.
* `OK` The link is in a good state.

objectValue.description: The base object for values found in the **Cell.objectValue** attribute. Its **objectType** attribute indicates the type of the object. This object itself is not used directly.

overrideValidation.description: (Admin only) Indicates whether the cell value can contain a value outside of the validation limits (value = **true**). When using this parameter, you must also set **strict** to **false** to bypass value type checking. This property is honored for POST or PUT actions that update rows.

strict.description: Set to **false** to enable lenient parsing. Defaults to **true**. You can specify this attribute in a request, but it is never present in a response.

value.description: A string, number, or a Boolean value -- depending on the cell type and the data in the cell. Cell values larger than 4000 characters are silently truncated. An empty cell returns no value.

format.description: Format descriptor. Only returned if the include query string parameter contains format and this row has a non-default format applied.

inCriticalPath.description: Only returned, with a value of true, if the sheet is a project sheet with dependencies enabled and this row is in the critical path.

locked.description: Indicates whether the row is locked.

lockedForUser.description: Indicates whether the row is locked for the requesting user.

modifiedBy.description: User object containing name and email of the last person to modify this row.

permaLink.description: URL that represents a direct link to the row in Smartsheet. Only returned if the include query string parameter contains rowPermalink.

version.description: Sheet version number that is incremented every time a sheet is modified.

showParentRowsForFilters.description: Returned only if there are column filters on the sheet. Value = **true** if "show parent rows" is enabled for the filters.

id.description: The Id of the dashboard, report, sheet, or template from which the enclosing dashboard, report, sheet, or template was created.

summary.description: Represents the entire summary, or a list of defined fields and values, for a specific sheet.

fields.description: Array of summary (or metadata) fields defined on the sheet.

contactOptions.description: Array of ContactOption objects to specify a pre-defined list of values for the column. Column type must be CONTACT_LIST.

name.description: Can be a user's name, display name, or free text.

createdBy.description: User object containing name and email of the creator of this summary field.

displayValue.description: Visual representation of cell contents, as presented to the user in the UI.

formula.description: The formula for a cell, if set.

reportId.description: If non-null, this hyperlink is a link to the report with this Id.

sheetId.description: If non-null, this hyperlink is a link to the sheet with this Id.

sightId.description: If non-null, this hyperlink is a link to the dashboard with this Id.

url.description: When the hyperlink is a URL link, this property contains the URL value. When the hyperlink is a dashboard/report/sheet link (that is, dashboardId, reportId, or sheetId is non-null), this property contains the permalink to the dashboard, report, or sheet.

height.description: Original height (in pixels) of the uploaded image.

width.description: Original width (in pixels) of the uploaded image.

index.description: Field index or position. This number is zero-based.

locked.description: Indicates whether the field is locked.

lockedForUser.description: Indicates whether the field is locked for the requesting user.

modifiedBy.description: User object containing name and email of the user who most recently modified this summary field.

objectValue.description: The base object for values found in the **Cell.objectValue** attribute. Its **objectType** attribute indicates the type of the object. This object itself is not used directly.

options.description: When applicable for PICKLIST column type. Array of the options available for the field.

symbol.description: When applicable for PICKLIST column type.

title.description: Arbitrary name, must be unique within summary.

validation.description: Indicates whether summary field values are restricted to the type.

totalRowCount.description: The total number of rows in the sheet.

userPermissions.description: Describes the current user's editing permissions for a specific sheet.

summaryPermissions.description:
One of:
  * ADMIN: full control over fields.
  * READ_DELETE: sheet is owned by an individual account that doesn't
have summary capabilities. If a summary exists, the only possible operations are GET and DELETE fields.
  * READ_ONLY.
  * READ_WRITE: can edit values of existing fields, but not create
or delete fields, nor modify field type.

userSettings.description: Represents individual user settings for a specific sheet. User settings may be updated even on sheets where the current user only has read access (for example, viewer permissions or a read-only sheet).

criticalPathEnabled.description: Does this user have "Show Critical Path" turned on for this sheet? **NOTE**: This setting only has an effect on project sheets with dependencies enabled.

displaySummaryTasks.description: Does this user have "Display Summary Tasks" turned on for this sheet? Applies only to sheets where "Calendar View" has been configured.

version.description: A number that is incremented every time a sheet is modified.

workspace.description: Can contain dashboards, folders, reports, sheets, and templates.

permalink.description: URL that represents a direct link to the workspace in Smartsheet.

workspaces.description: Array of Workspace objects (containing just the workspace Id) that the requester has access to that make up the report.

items.description: Can contain dashboards, folders, reports, sheets, and templates.

permalink.description: URL that represents a direct link to the workspace in Smartsheet.

summaryPermissions.description:
One of:
  * ADMIN: full control over fields.
  * READ_DELETE: sheet is owned by an individual account that doesn't
have summary capabilities. If a summary exists, the only possible operations are GET and DELETE fields.
  * READ_ONLY.
  * READ_WRITE: can edit values of existing fields, but not create
or delete fields, nor modify field type.

displaySummaryTasks.description: Does this user have "Display Summary Tasks" turned on for this sheet? Applies only to sheets where "Calendar View" has been configured.

Array of CrossSheetReference objects.
Only returned if the [include](../../tag/sheets#operation/getSheet) query string parameter contains **crossSheetReferences**.

endColumnId.description: Defines ending edge of range when specifying one or more columns. To specify an entire column, omit the startRowId and endRowId parameters.

endRowId.description: Defines ending edge of range when specifying one or more rows. To specify an entire row, omit the startColumnId and endColumnId parameters.

id.description: Cross-sheet reference Id, guaranteed unique within referencing sheet.

name.description: Friendly name of reference. Auto-generated unless specified in Create Cross-sheet References.

startColumnId.description: Defines beginning edge of range when specifying one or more columns. To specify an entire column, omit the startRowId and endRowId parameters.

startRowId.description: Defines beginning edge of range when specifying one or more rows. To specify an entire row, omit the startColumnId and endColumnId parameters.

status.description:
Status of request:
 * 'BLOCKED' - A reference is downstream of a circular issue.
 * 'BROKEN' - The data source location (column, row or sheet) was
deleted.
 * 'CIRCULAR' - The formula reference is self referencing and cannot
be resolved.
 * 'DISABLED' - Updating the reference is temporarily disabled due
to maintenance.
 * 'INVALID/UNKNOWN' - The reference is new and had not been validated.
 * 'NOT_SHARED' - No common shared users.
 * 'OK' - The reference is in a good state.

userPermissions.description: Describes the current user's editing permissions for a specific sheet.

summaryPermissions.description:
One of:
  * ADMIN: full control over fields.
  * READ_DELETE: sheet is owned by an individual account that doesn't
have summary capabilities. If a summary exists, the only possible operations are GET and DELETE fields.
  * READ_ONLY.
  * READ_WRITE: can edit values of existing fields, but not create
or delete fields, nor modify field type.

userSettings.description: Represents individual user settings for a specific sheet. User settings may be updated even on sheets where the current user only has read access (for example, viewer permissions or a read-only sheet).

criticalPathEnabled.description: Does this user have "Show Critical Path" turned on for this sheet? **NOTE**: This setting only has an effect on project sheets with dependencies enabled.

displaySummaryTasks.description: Does this user have "Display Summary Tasks" turned on for this sheet? Applies only to sheets where "Calendar View" has been configured.

crossSheetReferences.description:
Array of CrossSheetReference objects.
Only returned if the [include](../../tag/sheets#operation/getSheet) query string parameter contains **crossSheetReferences**.

endColumnId.description: Defines ending edge of range when specifying one or more columns. To specify an entire column, omit the startRowId and endRowId parameters.

endRowId.description: Defines ending edge of range when specifying one or more rows. To specify an entire row, omit the startColumnId and endColumnId parameters.

id.description: Cross-sheet reference Id, guaranteed unique within referencing sheet.

name.description: Friendly name of reference. Auto-generated unless specified in Create Cross-sheet References.

startColumnId.description: Defines beginning edge of range when specifying one or more columns. To specify an entire column, omit the startRowId and endRowId parameters.

startRowId.description: Defines beginning edge of range when specifying one or more rows. To specify an entire row, omit the startColumnId and endColumnId parameters.

status.description:
Status of request:
 * 'BLOCKED' - A reference is downstream of a circular issue.
 * 'BROKEN' - The data source location (column, row or sheet) was
deleted.
 * 'CIRCULAR' - The formula reference is self referencing and cannot
be resolved.
 * 'DISABLED' - Updating the reference is temporarily disabled due
to maintenance.
 * 'INVALID/UNKNOWN' - The reference is new and had not been validated.
 * 'NOT_SHARED' - No common shared users.
 * 'OK' - The reference is in a good state.

summaryPermissions.description:
One of:
  * ADMIN: full control over fields.
  * READ_DELETE: sheet is owned by an individual account that doesn't
have summary capabilities. If a summary exists, the only possible operations are GET and DELETE fields.
  * READ_ONLY.
  * READ_WRITE: can edit values of existing fields, but not create
or delete fields, nor modify field type.

userSettings.description: Represents individual user settings for a specific sheet. User settings may be updated even on sheets where the current user only has read access (for example, viewer permissions or a read-only sheet).

displaySummaryTasks.description: Does this user have "Display Summary Tasks" turned on for this sheet? Applies only to sheets where "Calendar View" has been configured.

interactionType.description:
Specifies what happens when a user clicks the widget. The type will determine what other properties are needed.
 * DISTI_COPY - a distribution link, only available if org has distribution
links enabled.
 * NONE - do nothing, no other attribute required.
 * SMARTSHEET_ITEM - open a Smartsheet item that is not the SOURCE_SHEET,
must also have one of the following attributes:
    * dashboardId
    * folderId
    * reportId
    * sheetId
    * workspaceId
 * SOURCE_SHEET - open the container where the widget data comes from,
no other attribute required.
 * WEB -  launch the URL, must also have url attribute.

fit.description:
Describes how the image occupies the available space of its widget.
 * ACTUAL_SIZE - Uses the original image width and height dimensions.
 * FILL - Scales the image to maintain its aspect ratio while filling
its entire widget. If the image aspect  ratio does not match the aspect ratio of its widget, then the image will be clipped to fit.
 * FIT - Scales the image to maintain its aspect ratio while fitting
within its widget. The image will be  "letterboxed" if its aspect ratio does not match the aspect ratio of its widget. Default value for new  image widgets and for existing image widgets where this property has not been explicitly set.

htmlContent.description:
The widget contents as HTML. The Rich Text widget supports the following subset of HTML tags and CSS Styles:

HTML
  * a - hyperlink
  * br - line break
  * li - list item
  * ol - ordered list
  * p - paragraph
  * span - section of the document
  * ul - unordered list

CSS
  * color
  * font-family
  * font-size
  * font-style
  * font-weight
  * text-align
  * text-decoration
